subject: Law
title: Liquidated Damages
description: A quick win: understand Liquidated Damages.

hook.text: A construction contract says $1,000 per day for delays. The project runs over. The clause kicks in automatically.

buildup.text: Liquidated damages are pre-agreed amounts that parties set in the contract for specific breaches.

discovery.text: They're valid if the amount is a reasonable estimate of anticipated harm and actual damages would be hard to calculate.

twist.text: If the amount is grossly disproportionate, courts treat it as a penaltyâ€”and penalties are unenforceable.

climax.text: The line between liquidated damages and penalties is thin. Reasonableness at the time of contracting is the key test.

punchline.text: Agree on the price of breach in advance. Just keep it reasonable.

quiz.question: When are liquidated damages enforceable?
options: When they reasonably estimate anticipated harm
